comments.author: jruderman@gmail.com
comments.creator: jruderman@gmail.com
comments.text:
Created attachment 572946
testcase

1. Run a debug build of Firefox with XPCOM_MEM_LEAK_LOG=2
2. Load the testcase
3. Quit Firefox

Result: trace-refcnt reports 1 nsDocument leaked
comments.raw_text:
1. Run a debug build of Firefox with XPCOM_MEM_LEAK_LOG=2
2. Load the testcase
3. Quit Firefox

Result: trace-refcnt reports 1 nsDocument leaked

In the shutdown CC, the nsDocument has two references, one from nsNodeInfoManager, one unknown, the latter which is keeping this alive.  I'm not brave enough to attempt refcount logging nsDocument.  bug 704240 might provide more information.
comments.text: In the shutdown CC, the nsDocument has two references, one from nsNodeInfoManager, one unknown, the latter which is keeping this alive.  I'm not brave enough to attempt refcount logging nsDocument.  bug 704240 might provide more information.
comments.creator: continuation@gmail.com
comments.author: continuation@gmail.com

comments.raw_text: I'm trying out the DMD heap scanner on this. It looks like maaaaaybe sCachedMainThreadChain has a reference to the document, which would be a strong one. I'm not sure if that makes any sense, though, and I have a bunch more references to dig through.
comments.text: I'm trying out the DMD heap scanner on this. It looks like maaaaaybe sCachedMainThreadChain has a reference to the document, which would be a strong one. I'm not sure if that makes any sense, though, and I have a bunch more references to dig through.
comments.creator: continuation@gmail.com
comments.author: continuation@gmail.com

comments.creator: bugs@pettay.fi
comments.author: bugs@pettay.fi
comments.raw_text: sCachedMainThreadChain should never have pointers to anything. It just caches the storage for the event target chain (if the previous chain was <= 128 event targets)
comments.text: sCachedMainThreadChain should never have pointers to anything. It just caches the storage for the event target chain (if the previous chain was <= 128 event targets)
I think bug 1172165 will "fix" this by making the link not work.
comments.raw_text: I think bug 1172165 will "fix" this by making the link not work.
